Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322

Class EmailAddressParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322.EmailAddressParser
  • public final class EmailAddressParser
extends java.lang.Object
    High-performance RFC 5322 compliant email address parser.

    Supports all RFC 5322 address formats including:

    • Individual addresses: user@domain.com
    • Named addresses: "John Doe" <user@domain.com>
    • Groups: My Group: user1@domain.com, user2@domain.com;
    • Quoted strings with escaped characters

    This implementation prioritizes performance through:

    • Single-pass parsing without backtracking
    • Minimal object allocation
    • No regex usage
    • O(n) time complexity where n is input length

    This class cannot be instantiated. All methods are static.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Method Detail

      • parseEmailAddressList

        public static java.util.List<EmailAddress> parseEmailAddressList​(java.lang.String value)
        Parse a list of email addresses from an RFC 5322 header value.
        Parameters:
        value - the header field value (e.g., To, Cc, Bcc field content)
        Returns:
        list of EmailAddress objects, or null if parsing fails

      • parseEmailAddressList

        public static java.util.List<EmailAddress> parseEmailAddressList​(java.lang.String value,
                                                                 boolean smtputf8)
        Parse a list of email addresses with optional SMTPUTF8 support (RFC 6532).

        When smtputf8 is true, UTF-8 characters are permitted in email addresses (local-part, domain, and display-name) per RFC 6531/6532 (Internationalized Email).

        Parameters:
        value - the header field value (e.g., To, Cc, Bcc field content)
        smtputf8 - if true, allow UTF-8 characters per RFC 6531/6532
        Returns:
        list of EmailAddress objects, or null if parsing fails

      • parseEmailAddress

        public static EmailAddress parseEmailAddress​(java.lang.String value)
        Parse a single email address with full RFC 5322 syntax.

        This method supports the full RFC 5322 address format including display names and angle brackets. For SMTP envelope addresses, use parseEnvelopeAddress(String) instead.

        Parameters:
        value - the email address string
        Returns:
        the parsed EmailAddress, or null if parsing fails or value is empty

      • parseEnvelopeAddress

        public static EmailAddress parseEnvelopeAddress​(java.lang.String value)
        Parse an SMTP envelope address (MAIL FROM or RCPT TO).

        SMTP envelope addresses per RFC 5321 must be in the simple form local-part@domain without display names, angle brackets, or comments. This method is optimized for this use case.

        Parameters:
        value - the envelope address (e.g., "user@example.com")
        Returns:
        the parsed EmailAddress, or null if invalid

      • parseEnvelopeAddress

        public static EmailAddress parseEnvelopeAddress​(java.lang.String value,
                                                boolean smtputf8)
        Parse an SMTP envelope address with optional SMTPUTF8 support (RFC 6531).

        SMTP envelope addresses per RFC 5321 must be in the simple form local-part@domain without display names, angle brackets, or comments. When smtputf8 is true, UTF-8 characters are permitted in the local-part and domain per RFC 6531 (Internationalized Email).

        Parameters:
        value - the envelope address (e.g., "user@example.com" or "用户@例え.jp")
        smtputf8 - if true, allow UTF-8 characters per RFC 6531
        Returns:
        the parsed EmailAddress, or null if invalid
